00058 /**
00059  * @brief Delete a file, or a folder and its contents.
00060  * 
00061  * @author Aidan Lister <aidan@php.net>
00062  * @version 1.0.3
00063  * @link http://aidanlister.com/repos/v/function.rmdirr.php
00064  * @param string $dirname Directory to delete.
00065  * @return bool Returns TRUE on success, FALSE on failure.
00066  * @licence Public Domain
00067  */
00068 function rmdirr($dirname) {
00069     // sanity check
00070     if (!file_exists($dirname)) {
00071         return false;
00072     }
00073     
00074     // simple delete for a file
00075     if (is_file($dirname) || is_link($dirname)) {
00076         return unlink($dirname);
00077     }
00078     
00079     // loop through the folder
00080     $dir = dir($dirname);
00081     while (false !== ($entry = $dir->read())) {
00082         // skip pointers
00083         if ($entry == '.' || $entry == '..') {
00084             continue;
00085         }
00086         
00087         // recursive
00088         rmdirr($dirname . DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR . $entry);
00089     }
00090     
00091     // clean up
00092     $dir->close();
00093     return rmdir($dirname);
00094 }

00098  * 
00099  * This function will remove the @charset line if it exists.
00100  * 
00101  * @param string $filename Filename to the css file.
00102  * @return string The contents of the file.
00103  */
00104 function file_get_contents_css($filename) {
00105     $file = file_get_contents($filename);
00106     
00107     // get first line of file
00108     $firstline = substr($file, 0, stripos($file, ';') + 1);
00109     
00110     // if its @charset then remove it
00111     if (strtolower(substr($firstline, 0 ,8)) == '@charset') {
00112         return substr($file, strlen($firstline));
00113     } else {
00114         // user forgot the @charset so return the file as it is
00115         return $file;

00195 /**
00196  * @brief Moves an element within an array.
00197  * @param array $array The array.
00198  * @param int $index The item to move.
00199  * @param mixed $direction The direction to move the item as a positive or negative integer. The words "up" or "down" may also be used.
00200  * @return mixed The array on success, or FALSE on failure.
00201  * @warning Only works on numerically indexed arrays.
00202  */
00203 function move_element(array $array, $index, $direction) {
00204     switch (strtolower(trim($direction))) {
00205         case 'up':
00206             $direction = 1;
00207             break;
00208         case 'down':
00209             $direction = -1;
00210             break;
00211         default:
00212             $direction = (int) $direction;
00213             break;
00214     }
00215     
00216     // make sure the index is within the array bounds
00217     if ($index < 0 || $index >= count($array)) {
00218         return false;
00219     }
00220     
00221     // make sure the target index is within the array bounds
00222     $index2 = $index + $direction;
00223     if ($index2 < 0 || $index2 >= count($array) || $index2 == $index) {
00224         return false;
00225     }
00226     
00227     // move the elements in the array
00228     $tmpItem = $array[$index2];
00229     $array[$index2] = $array[$index];
00230     $array[$index] = $tmpItem;
00231     
00232     return $array;
00233 }

00235 /**
00236  * @brief Returns uptime on a unix system.
00237  * 
00238  * The output format is D HH:MM:SS or HH:MM:SS if day is 0.
00239  * 
00240  * @return string The uptime.
00241  */
00242 function get_uptime() {
00243     // set handle
00244     $handle = fopen('/proc/uptime', 'r');
00245     
00246     if(!$handle) {
00247         trigger_error("Function get_uptime() failed, cannot open /proc/uptime", E_USER_ERROR);
00248         return false;
00249     } else {
00250         // open handle
00251         $proc = fgets($handle);
00252         // close handle
00253         fclose($handle);
00254         
00255         // remove idle time and fractions of a second
00256         $result = round(substr($proc,0,strpos($proc,' ')));
00257         
00258         // divide up result
00259         $parts['day'] = floor($result / 86400);
00260         $parts['hour'] = floor(($result - ($parts['day'] * 86400)) / 3600);
00261         $parts['minute'] = floor(($result - ($parts['day'] * 86400) - ($parts['hour'] * 3600)) / 60);
00262         $parts['second'] = floor($result - ($parts['minute'] * 60) - ($parts['day'] * 86400) - ($parts['hour'] * 3600));
00263         
00264         // format uptime for output in format D HH:MM:SS or HH:MM:SS if day is 0
00265         $uptime = '';
00266         if ($parts['day']) {
00267             $uptime .=  $parts['day'] . ' ';
00268         }
00269         $uptime .= sprintf('%02d', $parts['hour']) . ':' . sprintf('%02d', $parts['minute']) . ':' . sprintf('%02d', $parts['second']);
00270     }
00271     
00272     return $uptime;
00273 }

00346 /**
00347  * @brief Truncates a string to a given length.
00348  * 
00349  * If the string ends in a punctuation mark then it is removed before applying \c $etc.
00350  * 
00351  * Punctuation marks include [.!?:;,-] and the space character.
00352  * 
00353  * @param string $text The text to truncate.
00354  * @param int $length The length to truncate to.
00355  * @param string $etc[optional] Addition to the string after truncating. Defaults to ellipsis.
00356  * @return string Returns truncated string plus addition if supplied.
00357  */
00358 function truncate($text, $length, $etc = '...') {
00359     $text = html_entity_decode($text, ENT_QUOTES);
00360     if (strlen($text) > $length) {
00361         $text = substr($text, 0, $length);
00362         
00363         $punctuation = ' .!?:;,-'; //punctuation you want removed
00364         $text = (strspn(strrev($text), $punctuation) != 0) ? substr($text, 0, -strspn(strrev($text), $punctuation)) : $text;
00365         
00366         $text = $text . $etc;
00367     }
00368     
00369     $text = htmlentities($text, ENT_QUOTES);
00370     return $text;
00371 }

00482 /**
00483  * @brief Counts files recursively.
00484  * 
00485  * @see Boo_Helper::getFileExtension()
00486  * @param string $path The path.
00487  * @param mixed[optional] $fileList The file list.
00488  * @return array Returns an array of files where the key is the file extension and the value is the count, or FALSE on error.
00489  */
00490 function count_files($path, &$fileList = false) {
00491     $files = array();
00492     // open dir
00493     $dir = opendir($path);
00494     
00495     if (!$dir) {
00496         trigger_error("Path {$path} is not valid", E_USER_ERROR);
00497         return false;
00498     }
00499     
00500     while (($file = readdir($dir)) !== false) {
00501         
00502         if ($file != '.' && $file != '..') {
00503             if (is_dir($path . DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR . $file)){
00504                 // recursive
00505                 $files = array_add($files, count_files($path . DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR . $file . DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR, $fileList));
00506             }
00507             else {
00508                 
00509                 if (is_array($fileList)) {
00510                     $fileList[] = "{$path}{$file}";
00511                 }
00512                 
00513                 // get file extension
00514                 $ext = Boo_Helper::getFileExtension($file);
00515                 
00516                 // increase file count
00517                 (isset($files[$ext])) ? $files[$ext]++ : $files[$ext] = 1;
00518             }
00519         }
00520     }
00521     // close dir
00522     closedir($dir);
00523     return $files;
00524 }

00526 /**
00527  * @brief Adds the values of one array to the values of another array with the same key.
00528  * 
00529  * @param array $a1 The first array.
00530  * @param array $a2 The second array.
00531  * @return array Returns the combined array.
00532  */
00533 function array_add(array $a1, array $a2) {
00534     // add items in a1 that are also in a2
00535     foreach ($a1 as $key => $value) {
00536         if (array_key_exists($key, $a2)) {
00537             $a1[$key] = $a1[$key] + $a2[$key];
00538         }
00539     }
00540     
00541     // add items in a2 that are not in a1
00542     foreach ($a2 as $key=>$value) {
00543         if (!array_key_exists($key, $a1)) {
00544             $a1[$key] = $a2[$key];
00545         }
00546     }
00547     
00548     return $a1;
00549 }

00563 /**
00564  * @brief Returns a string with words removed from the end.
00565  * 
00566  * Removes all trailing whitespace as well.
00567  * 
00568  * @return string Returns string without word if found, original string otherwise.
00569  * @param string $str The string to manipulate.
00570  * @param string $word The word to remove.
00571  * @param bool $caseSensitive[optional] Use case sensitive searching.
00572  */
00573 function rtrim_word($str, $word, $caseSensitive = true) {
00574     $str = rtrim($str);
00575     $word = rtrim($word);
00576     $strLen = strlen($str);
00577     $wordLen = strlen($word);
00578     
00579     if ($caseSensitive) {
00580         if (substr($str, $wordLen * -1) == $word) {
00581             return rtrim(substr($str, 0, $strLen - $wordLen));
00582         }
00583     } else {
00584         if (strtolower(substr($str, $wordLen * -1)) == strtolower($word)) {
00585             return rtrim(substr($str, 0, $strLen - $wordLen));
00586         }
00587     }
00588     
00589     return $str;
00590 }

00633 /**

00639         ob_start();

00641         $contents = ob_get_contents();
00642         ob_end_clean();
